page.title: 13Village Hall - Rode.
page.content: Rode Memorial Hall was built in 1953 in memory of the fallen of World War II.It is a brick building standing on land donated by a benefactor. It is in regular use, both by the villagers and outside organisations. Possessing good kitchen and stage facilities, gas central heating and a large car park it is the hub of village activites. It is run by a committee of members from all villlage organisations. It is used as a local and general election polling station, for wedding receptions and parties, and groups such as Scouts, British Legion, Womens Institute and the Wine Circle. There is a monthly baby clinic and weekly surgery. Hire charges range from Â£3 per morning, afternoon or evening for villagers (Â£5 for outsiders), to Â£30 for a village wedding (Â£40 for outsiders).
